content.description: View the questions before you start the survey (external link)
list: Your response helps us to provide real-time information during the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic.
This is so the government has the information it needs to manage the UK’s response.

content.description: Thank you for completing this survey at this challenging time.

list: Information should relate to the UK.
We will treat your information securely and confidentially.
This survey is refreshed every two weeks. To avoid losing data, please submit by the return date and before the next fortnightly survey is published.

content.description: This section asks for general information on the business's trading status.
This section asks for information about:

list: how the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic may have affected the business's turnover in the last two weeks
operating costs
profits

content.description: This section asks for information about the business's exporting and importing activities.

questions.question: Prices of materials, goods and services

content.description: This section asks for information on any changes to the prices of goods and services bought or sold by the business in the last two weeks.
This section asks for information about how the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic may have affected the business's stock.
This section asks for information on:

list: any applications that the business made for government financial initiatives or schemes
any applications the business intends to make for government initiatives or schemes
any applications for non-government financial support
cash reserves

content.description: This section asks for information about the business's workforce such as the:

list: percentage on, for example, furlough leave or working from home
percentage returning from furlough or homeworking, or would be made permanently redundant
percentage of furloughed staff receiving top-ups in addition to the Coronavirus Job Retention Scheme (CJRS) payment
impact of homeworking, and staff's productivity

content.description: It also asks about future site closures.
This section asks for information about safety measures that your business may have put in place for staff and for customers, and how these may be affecting operating costs.

blocks.title: Trading status of your business
blocks.description: This section asks for general information on the business's trading status.

questions.title: Which of the following statements best describes {{ metadata['ru_name'] }}'s trading status?

options.label: Currently trading and has been for more than the last two weeks

options.label: Paused trading and does not intend to restart in the next two weeks
options.value: Paused trading and does not intend to restart in the next two weeks

blocks.title: Turnover, operating costs and profits
blocks.description:
This section asks for information about:

  • how the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic may have affected the business's turnover in the last two weeks
  • operating costs
  • profits

questions.title: In the last two weeks, how has the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic affected {{ metadata['ru_name'] }}'s turnover, compared with normal expectations for this time of year?

content.description: Exclude:

list: change expected due to seasonal effects
change expected due to normal patterns of business activity

options.label: Turnover has increased by more than 50%
options.value: Turnover has increased by more than 50%

options.label: Turnover has increased by up to 20%
options.value: Turnover has increased by up to 20%

options.label: Turnover has decreased by up to 20%
options.value: Turnover has decreased by up to 20%

options.label: Turnover has decreased by more than 50%
options.value: Turnover has decreased by more than 50%

questions.title: Please explain in more detail how the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic affected turnover in the last two weeks

options.label: Expect turnover to increase a little
options.value: Expect turnover to increase a little

options.label: Expect turnover to stay the same
options.value: Expect turnover to stay the same

options.label: Expect turnover to decrease a little
options.value: Expect turnover to decrease a little

questions.title: In the last two weeks, how did turnover compare to operating costs?

content.description: Exclude from operating costs:

list: labour costs
depreciation

content.description: This refers to costs for the business such as rental payments, finance and interest payments, and energy bills.

options.label: Turnover exceeded operating costs by more than 50%
options.value: Turnover exceeded operating costs by more than 50%

options.label: Turnover exceeded operating costs between 20% and 50%
options.value: Turnover exceeded operating costs between 20% and 50%

options.label: Turnover exceeded operating costs by up to 20%
options.value: Turnover exceeded operating costs by up to 20%

options.label: Turnover was equal to operating costs
options.value: Turnover was equal to operating costs

options.label: Operating costs exceeded turnover by up to 20%
options.value: Operating costs exceeded turnover by up to 20%

options.label: Operating costs exceeded turnover between 20% and 50%
options.value: Operating costs exceeded turnover between 20% and 50%

options.label: Operating costs exceeded turnover by more than 50%
options.value: Operating costs exceeded turnover by more than 50%

questions.title: In the last two weeks, how has the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic affected your business's profits, compared with normal expectations for this time of year?

options.label: Profits have increased by more than 50%
options.value: Profits have increased by more than 50%

options.label: Profits have increased by between 20% and 50%
options.value: Profits have increased by between 20% and 50%

options.value: Profits have increased by up to 20%

options.label: Profits have decreased by up to 20%
options.value: Profits have decreased by up to 20%

options.value: Profits have decreased by between 20% and 50%

options.label: Profits have decreased by more than 50%
options.value: Profits have decreased by more than 50%

blocks.title: Access to financial support
blocks.description:
This section asks for information on:

  • any applications that the business made for government financial initiatives or schemes
  • any applications the business intends to make for government initiatives or schemes
  • any applications for non-government financial support
  • cash flow

questions.title: Has {{ metadata['ru_name'] }} applied for any of the following schemes?

options.label: Coronavirus Job Retention Scheme
options.description: UK Government scheme that covers 80% of pay (up to 2,500 a month) for furloughed staff

options.label: Government-backed accredited loans or finance agreements
options.value: Government-backed accredited loans or finance agreements
options.description: For example, COVID Corporate Financing Facility (CCFF), Coronavirus Business Interruption Loan Scheme (CBILS or CLBILS), Bounce Back Loan Scheme (BBLS) or loans from devolved governments

options.label: Business grants funded by the UK and devolved governments
options.value: Business grants funded by the UK and devolved governments
options.description: Including small business grant funds and sector-specific grants in England, Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland

options.label: Not applied for any of these schemes
options.value: Not applied for any of these schemes

values: Government-backed accredited loans or finance agreements
Business grants funded by the UK and devolved governments

values: Business grants funded by the UK and devolved governments

content.description: For example:

list: how easy or difficult it was to apply
how you heard about these schemes
if there were any barriers to you applying, such as eligibility
if there was enough guidance about the application process
if you received funding, how long it took

blocks.title: Operational performance
blocks.description:
This section asks for information about your workforce such as the:

  • percentage, for example, on furlough leave or working from home
  • percentage returning from furlough or homeworking
  • percentage of furloughed staff receiving top-ups in addition to the Coronavirus Job Retention Scheme (CJRS) payments
  • impact of homeworking, and staff's productivity

It also asks about future site closures.

questions.title: In the last two weeks, approximately what percentage of {{ metadata['ru_name'] }}'s workforce were:
questions.description: Your answers should add up to 100%. If your workforce did not fall into one of the categories, enter "0".

answers.label: On partial or full furlough leave
answers.description: Under the terms of the UK Government's Coronavirus Job Retention Scheme

answers.label: Working at their normal place of work
answers.description: Include those who were normally homeworkers before the pandemic

answers.label: Working from home instead of at their normal place of work
answers.description: Exclude those who were normally homeworkers before the pandemic

answers.label: On sick leave or not working due to coronavirus (COVID-19)  symptoms, self-isolation or quarantine

values: Currently trading and has been for more than the last two weeks
Started trading within the last two weeks after a pause in trading
Paused trading but intends to restart in the next two weeks
Paused trading and does not intend to restart in the next two weeks

questions.title: Is your business providing top-ups to any furloughed workers' pay, on top of the Coronavirus Job Retention Scheme (CJRS) payments?

content.description: Include:

list: workers on partial and full furlough leave

content.description: Exclude:

list: employer’s National Insurance and contribution to pension schemes

options.label: Yes, the business is providing a top-up
options.value: Yes, the business is providing a top-up

options.label: No, the business is not providing a top-up
options.value: No, the business is not providing a top-up

values: Yes, the business is providing a top-up
No, the business is not providing a top-up
Currently trading and has been for more than the last two weeks
Started trading within the last two weeks after a pause in trading
No, the business is not providing a top-up
Paused trading but intends to restart in the next two weeks
Paused trading and does not intend to restart in the next two weeks

questions.title: Of those on furlough leave, approximately what percentage of workers have had their pay topped up?

content.description: Include:

list: employees furloughed for either all, or some, of their normal working hours
employees the business is claiming for via the Coronavirus Job Retention Scheme (CJRS)

definitions.title: How you might answer this question

content.description: If 50% of your workforce have been furloughed, but you are topping up the pay for all of those furloughed workers, the answer would be 100%. If you are topping up the pay for half of those furloughed workers, the answer would be 50%.

answers.label: Percentage of furloughed workers with top-up pay

values: Paused trading but intends to restart in the next two weeks
Paused trading and does not intend to restart in the next two weeks

questions.title: In the last two weeks, approximately what percentage of your workforce have:

answers.label: Returned from furlough to homeworking, either fully or partially
Returned from furlough to the normal workplace, either fully or partially
Moved from homeworking  to the normal workplace
answers.description: Exclude those who normally worked from home before the pandemic

questions.title: In the next two weeks, approximately what percentage of your workforce will:

answers.label: Return from furlough to homeworking, either fully or partially
Return from furlough to the normal workplace, either fully or partially
Return to the workplace from homeworking, either fully or partially
answers.description: Exclude those who normally worked from home before the pandemic

questions.title: Has your business had more staff working from home as a result of the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic?
How has the increase in homeworking affected the productivity of your workforce?
Does your business intend to use increased homeworking as a permanent business model going forward?
Why do you intend to use increased homeworking as a permanent business model going forward?

options.label: Ability to recruit from a wider geographical pool
options.value: Ability to recruit from a wider geographical pool

options.label: Ability to better match jobs to skills
options.value: Ability to better match jobs to skills

questions.title: Why do you not intend to use increased homeworking as a permanent business model going forward?

options.label: Reduced reliability and retention of staff
options.value: Reduced reliability and retention of staff
